verses.kjv: And Balaam said unto Balak, Build me here seven altars, and prepare me here seven oxen and seven rams.
verses.web: Balaam said to Balak, “Build here seven altars for me, and prepare here seven bulls and seven rams for me.”
verses.ct: Balaam said to Balak, "Build 7 altars for me here, and prepare 7 bulls and 7 rams."

verses.kjv: And Balak did as Balaam had spoken; and Balak and Balaam offered on every altar a bullock and a ram.
verses.web: Balak did as Balaam had spoken; and Balak and Balaam offered on every altar a bull and a ram.
verses.ct: Balak did what Balaam asked. Together, Balak and Balaam offered a bull and a ram on each altar.

verses.kjv: And Balaam said unto Balak, Stand by thy burnt offering, and I will go: peradventure the LORD will come to meet me: and whatsoever he sheweth me I will tell thee. And he went to an high place.
verses.web: Balaam said to Balak, “Stand by your burnt offering, and I will go. Perhaps LORD will come to meet me. Whatever he shows me I will tell you.” He went to a bare height.
verses.ct: Then Balaam told Balak, "Stay here beside your burnt offering while I go. Maybe the LORD will come and meet with me, and whatever he reveals, I'll tell you." Then Balaam went off to a barren hilltop.

verses.kjv: And God met Balaam: and he said unto him, I have prepared seven altars, and I have offered upon every altar a bullock and a ram.
verses.web: God met Balaam, and he said to him, “I have prepared the seven altars, and I have offered up a bull and a ram on every altar.”
verses.ct: God met Balaam there, and Balaam said to him, "I've set up 7 altars and offered a bull and a ram on each one."

verses.kjv: And the LORD put a word in Balaam’s mouth, and said, Return unto Balak, and thus thou shalt speak.
verses.web: LORD put a word in Balaam’s mouth, and said, “Return to Balak, and thus you shall speak.”
verses.ct: The LORD gave Balaam a message and said, "Go back to Balak and deliver these exact words."

verses.kjv: And he returned unto him, and, lo, he stood by his burnt sacrifice, he, and all the princes of Moab.
verses.web: He returned to him, and behold, he was standing by his burnt offering, he, and all the princes of Moab.
verses.ct: So Balaam returned and found Balak still standing beside his burnt offering, along with all the leaders of Moab.

verses.kjv: And he took up his parable, and said, Balak the king of Moab hath brought me from Aram, out of the mountains of the east, saying, Come, curse me Jacob, and come, defy Israel.
verses.web: He took up his parable, and said, “From Aram has Balak brought me, the king of Moab from the mountains of the East. Come, curse Jacob for me. Come, defy Israel.
verses.ct: Then Balaam spoke his prophetic message: "Balak, king of Moab, brought me all the way from Aram, from the eastern mountains. He said, 'Come, put a curse on Jacob for me. Come, denounce Israel.'

verses.kjv: How shall I curse, whom God hath not cursed? or how shall I defy, whom the LORD hath not defied?
verses.web: How shall I curse whom God has not cursed? How shall I defy whom LORD has not defied?
verses.ct: But how can I curse someone God hasn't cursed? How can I denounce someone the LORD hasn't denounced?

verses.kjv: For from the top of the rocks I see him, and from the hills I behold him: lo, the people shall dwell alone, and shall not be reckoned among the nations.
verses.web: For from the top of the rocks I see him. From the hills I see him. Behold, it is a people that dwells alone, and shall not be listed among the nations.
verses.ct: From the rocky heights I look down and see them; from the hills I watch them. Here is a people that lives apart, not counting itself among the nations.

verses.kjv: Who can count the dust of Jacob, and the number of the fourth part of Israel? Let me die the death of the righteous, and let my last end be like his!
verses.web: Who can count the dust of Jacob, or count the fourth part of Israel? Let me die the death of the righteous! Let my last end be like his!”
verses.ct: Who could ever count the descendants of Jacob? They're as countless as dust! Who could number even a quarter of Israel? Let me die the death of the righteous — let my end be like theirs!"

verses.kjv: And Balak said unto Balaam, What hast thou done unto me? I took thee to curse mine enemies, and, behold, thou hast blessed them altogether.
verses.web: Balak said to Balaam, “What have you done to me? I took you to curse my enemies, and behold, you have blessed them altogether.”
verses.ct: Balak said to Balaam, "What have you done to me? I brought you here to curse my enemies, and instead you've blessed them!"

verses.kjv: And he answered and said, Must I not take heed to speak that which the LORD hath put in my mouth?
verses.web: He answered and said, “Must I not take heed to speak that which LORD puts in my mouth?”
verses.ct: Balaam replied, "Don't I have to speak exactly what the LORD puts in my mouth?"

verses.kjv: And Balak said unto him, Come, I pray thee, with me unto another place, from whence thou mayest see them: thou shalt see but the utmost part of them, and shalt not see them all: and curse me them from thence.
verses.web: Balak said to him, “Please come with me to another place, where you may see them. You shall see just part of them, and shall not see them all. Curse them from there for me.”
verses.ct: So Balak said, "Come with me to a different spot where you can see them. You'll only see part of their camp, not all of them. Curse them for me from there."

verses.kjv: And he brought him into the field of Zophim, to the top of Pisgah, and built seven altars, and offered a bullock and a ram on every altar.
verses.web: He took him into the field of Zophim, to the top of Pisgah, and built seven altars, and offered up a bull and a ram on every altar.
verses.ct: He took Balaam to the field of Zophim, on top of Pisgah. There he built 7 altars and offered a bull and a ram on each one.

verses.kjv: And he said unto Balak, Stand here by thy burnt offering, while I meet the LORD yonder.
verses.web: He said to Balak, “Stand here by your burnt offering, while I meet God over there.”
verses.ct: Balaam told Balak, "Stay here beside your burnt offering while I go meet with the LORD over there."

verses.kjv: And the LORD met Balaam, and put a word in his mouth, and said, Go again unto Balak, and say thus.
verses.web: LORD met Balaam, and put a word in his mouth, and said, “Return to Balak, and say this.”
verses.ct: The LORD met Balaam and gave him a message, saying, "Go back to Balak and tell him this."

verses.kjv: And when he came to him, behold, he stood by his burnt offering, and the princes of Moab with him. And Balak said unto him, What hath the LORD spoken?
verses.web: He came to him, and behold, he was standing by his burnt offering, and the princes of Moab with him. Balak said to him, “What has LORD spoken?”
verses.ct: When Balaam returned, Balak was still standing beside his burnt offering with the leaders of Moab. Balak asked him, "What did the LORD say?"

verses.kjv: And he took up his parable, and said, Rise up, Balak, and hear; hearken unto me, thou son of Zippor:
verses.web: He took up his parable, and said, “Rise up, Balak, and hear! Listen to me, you son of Zippor.
verses.ct: Balaam spoke his prophetic message: "Stand up, Balak, and listen! Pay attention, son of Zippor!

verses.kjv: God is not a man, that he should lie; neither the son of man, that he should repent: hath he said, and shall he not do it? or hath he spoken, and shall he not make it good?
verses.web: God is not a man, that he should lie, nor a son of man, that he should repent. Has he said, and will he not do it? Or has he spoken, and will he not make it good?
verses.ct: God is not a man, that he would lie, or a human being, that he would change his mind. Has he ever spoken and not followed through? Has he ever made a promise and not kept it?

verses.kjv: Behold, I have received commandment to bless: and he hath blessed; and I cannot reverse it.
verses.web: Behold, I have received a command to bless. He has blessed, and I can’t reverse it.
verses.ct: I was given a command to bless — he has blessed them, and I cannot reverse it.

verses.kjv: He hath not beheld iniquity in Jacob, neither hath he seen perverseness in Israel: the LORD his God is with him, and the shout of a king is among them.
verses.web: He has not seen iniquity in Jacob. Neither has he seen perverseness in Israel. LORD his God is with him. The shout of a king is among them.
verses.ct: He has seen no guilt in Jacob, no wrongdoing in Israel. The LORD their God is with them, and the shout of their King rings out among them.

verses.kjv: God brought them out of Egypt; he hath as it were the strength of an unicorn.
verses.web: God brings them out of Egypt. He has as it were the strength of the wild ox.
verses.ct: God brought them out of Egypt; he has the strength of a wild ox.

verses.kjv: Surely there is no enchantment against Jacob, neither is there any divination against Israel: according to this time it shall be said of Jacob and of Israel, What hath God wrought!
verses.web: Surely there is no enchantment with Jacob; Neither is there any divination with Israel. Now it shall be said of Jacob and of Israel, ‘What has God done!’
verses.ct: No sorcery can touch Jacob, and no divination can work against Israel. From now on, people will say of Jacob and Israel, 'Look what God has done!'

verses.kjv: Behold, the people shall rise up as a great lion, and lift up himself as a young lion: he shall not lie down until he eat of the prey, and drink the blood of the slain.
verses.web: Behold, a people rises up as a lioness. As a lion he lifts himself up. He shall not lie down until he eats of the prey, and drinks the blood of the slain.”
verses.ct: Look — this people rises like a lioness, like a lion lifting himself up. He won't lie down until he devours his prey and drinks the blood of the slain."

verses.kjv: And Balak said unto Balaam, Neither curse them at all, nor bless them at all.
verses.web: Balak said to Balaam, “Neither curse them at all, nor bless them at all.”
verses.ct: Balak said to Balaam, "Fine — if you won't curse them, then at least don't bless them either!"

verses.kjv: But Balaam answered and said unto Balak, Told not I thee, saying, All that the LORD speaketh, that I must do?
verses.web: But Balaam answered Balak, “Didn’t I tell you, saying, ‘All that LORD speaks, that I must do?’ ”
verses.ct: But Balaam answered Balak, "Didn't I tell you? Everything the LORD speaks, I must do."

verses.kjv: And Balak said unto Balaam, Come, I pray thee, I will bring thee unto another place; peradventure it will please God that thou mayest curse me them from thence.
verses.web: Balak said to Balaam, “Come now, I will take you to another place; perhaps it will please God that you may curse them for me from there.”
verses.ct: Then Balak said to Balaam, "Come, let me take you to yet another place. Maybe God will be willing to let you curse them for me from there."

verses.kjv: And Balak brought Balaam unto the top of Peor, that looketh toward Jeshimon.
verses.web: Balak took Balaam to the top of Peor, that looks down on the desert.
verses.ct: So Balak took Balaam to the top of Peor, which overlooks the wasteland.

verses.kjv: And Balaam said unto Balak, Build me here seven altars, and prepare me here seven bullocks and seven rams.
verses.web: Balaam said to Balak, “Build seven altars for me here, and prepare seven bulls and seven rams for me here.”
verses.ct: Balaam said to Balak, "Build 7 altars for me here, and prepare 7 bulls and 7 rams."

verses.kjv: And Balak did as Balaam had said, and offered a bullock and a ram on every altar.
verses.web: Balak did as Balaam had said, and offered up a bull and a ram on every altar.
verses.ct: Balak did as Balaam instructed and offered a bull and a ram on each altar.
